content.description:
This is the new 3 bolt extension to "Charlee and the Stick Factory". This extension allows you to climb to the top of the formation, through a deceivingly steep series of powerful and sequential moves. In my opinion, this route has some of the coolest moves in the Emeralds for the grade.

This route is named after my dog Toby, to continue on with the dog theme of "Charlee and the Stick Factory" and "Sage Finds the Golden Stick".
content.protection: SS Bolts/Hangers and Mussy hook lower offs.
content.location: Climb Charlee and the Stick factory, then continue through the roof and head wall to the top.

climbs.name: Sun Burn
climbs.fa: mike carville, kia burns, brad johnson

content.description: face and thin cracks lead up and left to top of triangular face. Crux just below top.
content.location: This route starts on the Right and at the 4th bolt it crosses "Solar Wind" and continues left and goes to the top where it shares top anchors with "Solar Wind"

climbs.name: Solar Winds
climbs.fa: mike carville, kia burns, brad johnson, john robinson

content.description: climb face/cracks then traverse top to anchors over left. In Mike Carville's 1991 guide book this was a top rope climb. It is now bolted.
content.location: left side of wall. See Emeralds main page. (Photos) This climb starts on the left and at the 4th bolt it crosses "Sunburn" and goes Right to top where it shares top anchors with "Sun Burn". The climb is 10c if you traverse in from the bottom from the left.

content.description:
Nice face to a big move out the airy roof.

Easier to start on the far left and traverse into the first bolt.
A bouldery traverse leads to easier climbing above
content.location: The lower cliff band below the main fortress wall

content.description: (This Route is so new it's not in the new North Tahoe Guide Book) 20' right of "Shadows on the Earth". Walk up a 3' wide ramp about 10', and clip the first bolt. A tricky little move gets you to a good stance and ready for the first crux. Maybe a jam, maybe a sidepull, maybe a wide stem, maybe a high step, maybe an undercling (you gotta figure it out). Now continue up to the headwall and make an abrupt left turn and traverse about as far as you can, then go up and see if you can figure out how to get over the roof. I made the clip at the roof easier as some gumby complained the hanger was too hard to clip so I added a perma draw. Now you need to figure out how to get over the overhang. There are some excellent holds over the top of the overhang but it might be a bit perplexing, getting to those good holds. There are holds there, you just need to find them. After the overhang is mounted you have easy 5.9 sailing to the top anchors. You might tell yourself that the move just before the top anchor is harder than 5.9 but, if you figure out what to do, you'll tell yourself, "that wasn't that hard".
content.location: Just right of "Shadows on the Earth" walk up a wide ledge to clip the first bolt.

content.description: climb bolted arete - two bouldery cruxes, one low and one high.
content.location: arete left of Shadows on the Earth

content.description: Climb gently overhanging face just left of main arete. Got it's name from John's Dog. If you knew this dog, you would know why a route is dedicated to her. Brad figured out a way to start the route without using the side wall on the left. It's fun, see if you can unlock it. This start is rated 5.11-
content.location: just right of big slab and left of Perils of Babylon (arete).
